alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Worth (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Worth and northwestern Harrison Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 700 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Irena, or 12 miles south of Mount Ayr, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eagleville, Irena, Blythedale, Allendale and Hatfield. This includes Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 105 and 114. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central and northwestern Missouri.
